meanings.definition: The act or process of forming a network or interconnected pattern.
meanings.sent1: The reticulations of the spider's web were intricate and delicate.
meanings.sent2: The reticulations of the city's roads made navigation confusing.
meanings.sent3: The reticulations of the yarn created a tangled mess for the knitter.
meanings.sent4: The reticulations of the tree branches against the sky resembled a complex puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The reticulations of the veins on the leaf were like tiny rivers on a map.

meanings.sent1: The reticulations of the fence formed a barrier around the garden.
meanings.sent2: The reticulations of the internet connect people from all over the world.
meanings.sent3: The reticulations of the puzzle pieces fit together perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The reticulations of the stars in the sky created a beautiful constellation.
meanings.sent5: The reticulations of the snowflakes on the window made a mesmerizing pattern.

meanings.sent1: The reticulations of the fabric gave it a unique texture.
meanings.sent2: The reticulations of the leaves showed signs of disease spreading.
meanings.sent3: The reticulations of the paint on the wall created an interesting design.
meanings.sent4: The reticulations of the clouds in the sky hinted at an upcoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The reticulations of the shadows on the ground danced in the sunlight.
